text.en: The key suddenly vanished, and the door made a clink sound.
A locked door stands here.
There’s nothing you can do
There's no hope for this person.
You're useless to do anything for this body

This is the girl that always hurt you.
She is bleeding, there might be a first aid nearby

Are you sure you want to help the girl 
that always bullies you?
This grave has "Hazuki" written on it.
Someone named Hazuki died here.
The grave has your name on it.
This person died today, their name is Hazuki.
Hazuki’s grave.

Why are you so afraid of dying? It’s the only thing we 
are guaranteed will happen in our life.

Looking for a way out? 
The key should be up north from here...
It's an unmarked grave. There is a key shining at the bottom.
Get lowered into your grave?

You jump into the pit and as you grab the key, 
you feel dirt being tossed on you.

Hazuki is slowly left to be buried,
the last thought in her mind is...

Argh! Let go of me! I don't need help from a weakling
like you!

B-B-But your bleeding! I can't just walk away
after seeing someone this badly hurt!

W-What are you some kind of doctor?!
Do you even know what your doing?!
Your attack went up by 2!
Your defense went up by 2!
Your HP went up by 10!
I’m sorry you didn't get the scholarship Hazuki,

I know you lack the funds to get a medical education
but just having passion isn’t enough these days.

What I can offer you is this,
your grades are qualified for the school,
but you'll have to work somewhere to earn the money.

I know a pretty good taco place that could use a few hands,
it’s also near a hospital,

so you could get a chance to find
some connections with the workers there.....

Yeah I stopped believing in my dreams when I stepped
foot in here, there's nothing more bottom rock than here.

Medical school? You're gonna be working here just to 
start studying again? How awful...
Hazuki wait!

You were just about to kick the bucket there!
Glad I got to you in time!

Why do you keep trying to push yourself this much?!
You know you'll end up ten feet under like this!
I..I have no choice...

Uh, yeah, you kinda do! You gotta run from
battles sometimes!

But you don't do that! You are strong and dependable!
I'm just...useless! Deadweight!

If I can't become a doctor... I'll just be a burden!
What's the point of my life if that's all I am...

Hazuki snap out of it! You are not a burden if you haven't
achieved anything! Not to me and not to anyone!

Am I not being a burden to you as you keep saving me?
You keep getting hurt because of me! Why do you save me?!

Because you said you couldn't live with yourself if you saw
someone you know die when you could have done something!

Well it's the same for me! Because your my friend!
You saved me even though I bullied you...
I don't want to die...
But I don't want others to die for me.
I have to keep going... and if I die trying...
Then at least you'll remember me, right Chizuru?
Ack! H-Hey! What are you doing?!
H-Hold still I'm trying to help...

A-ARCK! Y-Your no doctor! I'd rather get help from
A girl in a wheelchair!! She'll be more useful than you!

AAAAACH!!
.......

Oh? Huh?? I feel better actually...
What did you do?! gave me DRUGS?!

I just used this medical kit, I didn't use any drugs,
just bandages and antiseptic wipes.
...So what's the catch?
Catch?

You Cheesehead! You helping someone who always bullies you!
Your planning some kind of revenge right?!

Awawa- I would never! I just wanted to help you because
those people hurt you! I couldn't just leave you here...

I've always passed by people... that I couldn't help...
I never had any strength to do anything about it.

But even if you are my bully, I couldn't live with myself
if someone I knew died when I could have done something...!
...Orange girl...
I WASN'T GONNA DIE FROM THAT!!!
AHWAHAWA?!

YOU THINK I'M THAT WEAK?! I'd just eat some cheese steaks and
I'll be back in full energy again!
But... This helped too... Thanks Orange Girl...
My name is Hazuki...
Thank you Hazuki.
My name is-

Hey, there!
You're the newbie, right?
Yeah, that's me.

Please become my tennis training partner!
Nobody in this restaurant plays sports.
Ehhh!? But I don't play tennis.
Oh, you don't gotta hide it.

It's not hard to notice the sports gear
coming out of your pockets.

Umm... this is a golf club.
This isn't really for tennis.

Same deal!
You still hit balls with it!

I don't play sports at all, but I'm pretty sure
tennis and golf are two completely different things.
Wait, so why you even have a golf club in the first place?

Umm... to keep the bad guys away...
and maybe to scratch my back too...
Oh! Finally someone who understands!
I use my tennis racquet to scratch my back as well!

I can sense your sportmanship.
How about you scratch my back, and I scratch yours?
Ewwww! Noooooooooo...
Wait! Let me explain!
Please don't touch my back!
Okay, okay! I won't!
Listen, I just wanted to help a fellow sports enthusiast.
I told you I don't play sports!

You don't play sports, yet you caused a good chunk of
our employees here to explode.
Exploding people is not what sports is about!

Are you sure? Recently, all of my opponents
in a tennis match exploded.
Maybe it's good that I never got into sports.

I guess my hunch was right.
This isn't what sports is supposed to be about.
But now you see that the world is dangerous out there!

So if you just practice tennis with me one day,
I'll keep all of your stuff safe.
No thanks. I can keep all my stuff in my pockets.

With your girl pockets?
I don't think you can fit everything in there!
I'm in charge of inventory management here at Mad Meats.

And my tennis bag practically has all the space in
the world.

So if you have too much stuff, just hand it to me
and I'll hold on to it until you need it again!
Uuuuuuu...should I trust a criminal?
Shake my hand!
W-What? O-Okay...

There! See!
Good sportsmanship!

An evil tennis player would have grabbed your arm
and thrown you over the shoulder by now.
What kind of people are you meeting?
That's why I'm glad to meet a normal girl like you.
I'm Dennis. It's a pleasure to work with you.
I guess let's get along then.

For sure. Need me to hold anything for you
before you head out?

en: I have stuff to drop off
I need my stuff with me right now

text.en:
There's a variety of volumes of 
"How to Impress Girls with Farts."
For some reason, volume 1 is nowhere to be found.

A book cover about various tropical fruits 
takes your attention.

Flipping through the pages, you find that the book 
only says about peaches.
A faded book cover titled "Necromancing" pulls your attention.

As you flip the pages, it's about kissing techniques
on the neck specifically.
You wonder how this is all related to necromancy.

Looking at the selection of books, 
you tried pulling a book titled "Stationary"
It does not budge.
You randomly pull a book from the shelf this time.
You flip the pages without looking at the cover.

Reading thru the picture book, it recounts the story of how
a lame soldier was forced by a king to become the hero.

At the end, the lame soldier kneeled in front of the dark lord,
begging he doesn't want to be a hero anymore.

The book then tells you 
this is the best time to save your progress.
You realize you've been reading a game magazine.

And decided to close the magazine 
so you wouldn't be spoiled when you play it.

A clumsily hand made book made of paper and staplers 
titled "Hot Single Moms" pulls your attention
You open the book and it just says "your mom."

A dating book pulls your attention:
"101 Ways to Date Girls."
1st step says "Don't read books."
You decided to follow the book.

This book seems to be an erotic novel 
about a lizard servant girl.
Funny.

An ominous book entitled 
"How to Take Over The World" hooks your curiosity.
It seems someone has torn out all the pages.

Except for the author's personal note recipe 
about baking cookies.

You pull a colorful low-brow decorated book titled
"Ugliest Things in the World."
Opening it reveals a mirror in its pages.
...rude.
You confidently pick a random book and it's about vampires.
You flip thru the author's note and read a section:
...U rok! JM ur da luv of my deprzzing life u rok 2! MCR ROX!

There's a thick medical book 
covering various rare diseases and illnesses.

Upon reading it, you wonder if 
you will ever catch any of these illnesses.
You pull a book of an atlas of Shinecoast City.

However, some of the areas are crossed out 
or doodled with a child's drawing.

Well, you atleast appreciate the drawings of crabs 
on the edge of bodies of water.
You snatched a book of a gambler's diary...
and flipped at the end of the writer's last entry.
...A richer prize often demands a steeper price.

You clasped onto a fictional book 
about a time traveler's adventures.

Inspecting the back cover, 
you take notice of the blurb...
Life is timeless. But a lifetime is but a brief moment.
You plucked a manila folder of various newspaper clippings.
You take notice of a shot victim's last words.
"What are you going to do? Shoot me?"

You think it's about time for you 
to stop randomly picking up books from shelves.
Hazuki gets scared from being too curious too y'know.
There's cool manga here!
Too bad it's all in Japanese.
You can't read Japanese.
The door is locked.

You've collected a lot of books about medicine
over the years.

This shelf used to hold so many videogames,
but you haven't been playing any lately.
Will the carefree days of youth come back again?
You really piled up a lot notes during your pre-med studies.

You can still see the notebooks from years ago that
contains all your combos from fighting games.

Each note you had there has its own story
of a struggle you faced in a tournament.

You think back on the days when your struggles was with
games, and not real life.
This is where you store all of your clothes.

This is the bed that collected the most
drools and tears from you.

Welcome to Shinecoast City!
Thug Levels: High

Please watch your belongings.
We're not responsible for the thugs.
This door is locked.

Hazuki, you got a bump on your head.
Thought I told you to be careful.

It wasn't from running into walls!
It was falling into the sewers!
Same thing
How am I alive?

Maaan, one second I'm out smoking. 
Then I come back and the customers are dead.

dialogue.notes:
Dialogue change: 

From: The next customers died.

To: Then I come back and the customers are dead.

Need to find female variant of Ben avatar.

text.en:
Now Tanako is missing.
I need another cig.

Hey! You're not dead!
Escaped Tanako in the end?

W-Well, she caught me but some guys came
and we fell into the sewers.

Still a better fate than
all the customers in the restaurant today.
I can't believe exploding tacos are real...

We're investigating here.
Heard some gunshots and there's dead bodies around.

So unless you want to join them,
then stay out of the perimeter.

Back off! I'm trying to find out the cause
of the customers' deaths.

dialogue.notes:
Dialogue change:

From: "I'm working very hard..."

To: "I'm trying to find..."

Also removed: "today".

text.en: What the heck happened over there in that taco place?

dialogue.notes: Dialogue feels a little bit unnatural. You could reword it to: "What the heck happened in that taco place?"

text.en: I heard that the tacos there were the bomb.

dialogue.notes: You could remove the word "that" if you'd like.

text.en: But I didn't know they were literal bombs!

I-I'm sure the explosions you heard
was from the crazy bunch that attacked us.
Oh, you work there?

I see...
So you won't admit it.
You guys are just trying to save the image of the restaurant.
A-Aah! It's not like that!

Ahh...Shinecoast City Hospital.
Truly the lowest hospital bills in the nation.
Are the prices finally low now?

Still gotta pay a fortune.
But hey! It's cheaper here than elsewhere!
Even cheaper than the clinic across the street?
The one that John Smith owns?

Listen. We're talking about real hospitals.
Not fake clinics with posers.
Posers?
Yeah. That doctor there isn't licensed at all.

dialogue.notes:
Since we already know that we're talking about John Smith, you could just change it to "Yeah, she's not licensed at all."

But this also works too.

text.en: B-But... I think she's still cool...

Okay. Good luck missing a liver
on your next emergency.
A...Auuuu...
I'm trying to study, but I can't get any shut eye.

dialogue.notes:
Missing Jiro cutout.

Also, no Hazuki cutout in this scene.

text.en: Every night I keep hearing people crying from that hospital.
Aren't hospitals supposed to make people happy?

Living next to a restaurant means no worries
about delivery fees.
But honestly, I'm getting sick of tacos every day.

dialogue.notes:
Changed "to be honest" to "honestly".

Put a space in "everyday".

text.en:
Like, Tanako's Tacos really are the best
tacos in this town.
Nobody can deny that.
But even the best has diminishing value.
Still too lazy to cook though, so whatever!

dialogue.notes: Added a comma between though and so.

text.en: Oh, great. Are you here to use my bed too?
W-What do you mean?

I know you want to hide from the thugs
running around.

But that doesn't mean you should hide
under someone else's sheets.

I like my sheets, ma'am.
I wouldn't just use yours.
Oh, okay. Sorry about that.
I-I-I c-c-can't do it...
I c-c-can't let another person die.
I h-h-have to m-make a breakthrough.
W-Where did all of our research go!?

I want to go to the convenience store east from here.
But there are thugs all around and I'm too scared.
Maybe I should become a thug instead.

I just moved here, but can I please move my stuff
without thugs stopping me.

I kept getting told by people there's so much
opportunity here in Shinecoast City.
But I'm already getting creeped out by the people here.

I wonder if my laywer skills can
make a change in this town.

Sometimes, when I go outside my house,
I see an unusual sight.

I've only seen it twice, but why would the CEO of Shirokawa
Incorporated stand in front of the arcade?
She's too menacing in the news.
What business could she even have with us arcade rascals?
But that also gets me thinking...
Do CEOs of big corporations have real friends?
Or are all of their relationships done out of some gain?

If she makes friends at the arcade,
that would be so bonkers.
When will the arcade open again?

People have been saying that the owner has been
getting away with their electrical and heating bills.

dialogue.notes: This dialogue is a bit confusing. This is because I have to make the conclusion in my head that the arcade has been turned on and you can see the inside, as if it should be open. But this wasn't specified at all.

text.en:
I wonder how they can avoid all of that
with so much technology there.

dialogue.notes:
This feels a bit too formal with the word "technology". Perhaps, changing it to arcade cabinets might be better. 

But also, specifying what the arcade is avoiding or the arcade owner is avoiding is the important thing here.

From Jonas's perspective, it's bills, right?

text.en: They're probably closed because authorities got suspicious.

Ever since the governor was assassinated,
the building south of here has been closed off.

With a building this huge, I wonder how the governor
couldn't just hide from the thugs there.
I bet it's a whole maze in there.
Huh? Are you a thug?
I didn't know thugs could be pretty.

Maybe if you were the thug always threatening me
to visit Mad Meats...
Perhaps I could actually try it...

Those guys really need to know that hitting people
with pipes won't attract customers.
We're on lunch break, so scram!
So are you guys from Mad Meats?
Yeah, this is Mad Meats, but we ain't open right now.

T-That's because you guys are going around
hitting people.
We're not hitting people.
We're convincing them to come eat here.
T-That's not how restaurants work.
Oh? And what are you gonna do about it?
Alright, we'll see you later.

Oh, really?
Then I gotta stop you there.
W-Well...

I've already seen your crews' iron pipes.
They're not so scary.
Well, I don't have an iron pipe.

I'm a guard.
Not an advertiser with a pipe.
And since I'm a guard...
I have a gun.

Uhh, Mad Meats isn't open right now.
Sorry!
D-Do you know that bald guy from Mad Meats?
Oh, you mean Knell?

Yeah, he's out steali-
I mean at lunch right now!
Are you guys really a restaurant?
Huh? Do you got a problem with how we operate?

It's all good!
Being hungry just makes us act weird.
Nah, don't call us that.
Here. Let me fix up your brain for you.

Not again. I left my keycard at the office
and I can't get in.

Now I'm gonna miss out on the donuts our CEO
brought at the break room.

Maybe I got absent minded from hanging
out too much with the Mad Meats crew.

I really hope this company doesn't mind
me hanging out with them.
After all, they did attack us a while ago.

But these guys are actually pretty funny
if you hang out with them.
So cool.
Oh, I thought you'd be the girl who keeps visiting me.

That girl...
she keeps asking me to take her to the convenience store.
At first, she's asking me because she's scared of thugs.
But now, she wants to watch thugs with me as we walk.
I really hope being a thug doesn't become a fad around here.

Maybe I should take her to the lake east of here
and ask Juichigo for a boat ride.
That should get her mind off of things.

There's a sleeping woman.
Better not wake her up.
You can smell a very strong stench coming from this.
You definitely don't want to imagine what is inside.
There's lots of medical reports on this shelf.

You have a slight sense of excitement
as this is the field you're into.

However, these detailed reports are way beyond
your current understanding of the field.
You end up feeling disappointed in yourself instead.
A variety of expensive tools are inside.
Too bad they all look rusted and broken.

Our role as doctors is to ensure that our patients
stay healthy and alive.

But what if we could not save a patient?
Is there a way we can bring them back to life?
The possibility is very near impossible...

But attempt #3 of our experiment
almost brought in vital signs.
Major adjustments to procedure are still needed.

Finally after so many failed tests,
we may have somewhat of a valid result.
However, this comes with multiple problems...

The first problem is that the rat we revived
only lasted for 1 second.
Our second problem involves a strange change with the rat.
Not only did it become extremely aggressive in that second.

But it also transformed into something we are unable
to recognize.

Too many years were spent on this experiment
and we are running out of funds.

Unfortunately, this is the last day of our small
medical research center.

All staff will etiher return to regular duties
at the hospital, or resign completely.
We held out as long as we could with funding.

However, our larger concern regarding our leave was with
the dangers we were facing.

As we write our final report,
all of our test subjects are dead.

But there are times where we can hear sounds
outside our door when all of us are present here.

Today, we made the horrible decision to investigate
the sounds outside our door.
When we opened the door, we saw something horrendous.

Without hesitation, we decided to leave immediately
and abandon our research forever.

As I looked back for the final time, I saw the creature
with 4 long limbs crawling to us.
I will never come back to this field of study again.

If anyone is to inherit these premises,
you must lock these areas as strong as you can.
A cabinet hangs on the shelf.
Something looks particularly off about this.
There's a note here...
To open the path, the numbers are found through the history.
The note ends with a small doodle of a smiling cat.
This bed has a rotten, moldy smell.
This bed has a rotten, moldy smell.

You slide your hand underneath
the slimy bedsheet...
You swipe your hand below the bed to check around...
All you got in the end was your hand surrounded by dust.

It's an old table.
There's lots of dust underneath it.

Inside the cabinet is mostly just empty packets
and cracked flasks.

Lots of books regarding human biology
are lined up across the shelf.

Many research papers on deadly injuries
are stored in this shelf.

Jars and other containers in this shelf are stained
in a dark color.

Hi, Hazuki?
Need me to fix you up?
There! You're all better now!

You sure?
You don't gotta act all brave, ya know.
It's rude to look into people's computers without permission.
Plenty books of subjects you don't fully understand yet...
There's books about the human body, diseases, and...hacking?

If only reading things once
let you understand them completely.

A calming video of the mountains to make you forget
the pains of your health.
Bumping this cabinet would break everything inside.

Fortunately, you are too small and light
to cause any real damage.

The contents of the cabinet are disturbed,
but none were broken.
A sink to wash dirty dirt and germy germs away.
The door won't budge.
This feels like an area for staff only.

You're Hazuki.
You're a good girl.
Maybe you shouldn't tick off the doctor that just saved you.
Seems like John keeps this table clean.
There's a bunch of cat picture books here.

An empty reception desk. No real need for a proper one
if John is the only staff here.

Empty chairs just collecting dust.
Perhaps John doesn't really get a lot of patients.
I wonder how much paperwork they check?
That has to be why they take so long, right?
Can't wait to have my teeth checked!
Ah...T-this is the hospital...

dialogue.notes: I feel like "nervous" would be a better emotion here.

text.en: What's your point?
Can't believe I have to wait for this bullet wound treated!

dialogue.notes:
Dialogue change:

From: Can't believe I have to get this bullet wound treated!

text.en: B-Bullet wound?!
Why didn't you call for an ambulance?!?!
Are you crazy?!
Can't risk them using the ambulance even 5 feet away!

Imagine paying thousands of dollars just 
for a gloried taxi to get you next door.
No way!
Welcome. Are you feeling unwell today?
I'm always feeling bad.

Well, I can help you get started.
Do you have insurance?
N-No, I don't
Personally, I'll tell you to scram before the costs get you.

But I work here,
so I'm going to ask if you'd like to proceed.
S-Sorry, I'll just do better with my own health myself.
Do you need medical attention?
The patient seems gravely ill...

I hope we don't have to resort to treatment methods
that have severe life altering side effects.
I guess I deserved this from my life of crime...
We still can't find out the cure for this girl.

The incident from the taco restaurant nearby
is something we haven't seen yet.

dialogue.notes:
Dialogue suggestion: 

Dr. Hyman can probably make a mention about something like: "This girl was one of the victims from the nearby taco restaurant. I've never seen anything like this before..."

text.en:
For now, we can just keep extending her lifespan
until we find something.
"The bill they will receive however...
Ugh, they are not gonna be happy with me.
I-I don't wanna die...
Please... not yet...
I want to go home...
I'm losing my mind.

Every single family here
keeps complaining to me.

I understand that someone's life is stake,
but I'm losing sleep every day over this too.

Blame the disease.
Complaining to me won't make it better.

Can someone here at least give me
a bit of thanks?
Phew, it's always difficult.

dialogue.notes: "Phew" feels a bit weird here, but. It should be fine.

text.en: A nice smelling plant to distract you from the medicine smell.

dialogue.notes:
This dialogue could be changed to:

A nice smelling plant to distract you from the smell of medicine...

text.en:
There's a couple of flyers on the board.
They're mostly medical awareness for viruses.

One of the flyers is advertising a special deal
at Tanako's Tacos.

This is probably a fake image of Tanako
because you know she never smiles.
This board has flyers giving awareness to rat bites.
They made the rat look cute for some reason.

This board has flyers giving awareness
to skateboard accidents.

You wonder why it has a photo of the senator
on a skateboard.
Does he even skateboard?
Probably not.
...Or does he?

Worried about your health?
As long as you're above 0, you'll be fine!
You think about your health condition.

The sign on the door says that this room
belongs to Dr. Schultz.
Beyond the window is a view of a chaotic city.
A city which you call your home.
This is how you know if a patient is still alive.
A beautiful poster of your city.
Looking at the window literally gives you the same view.
This is where you hang a bag of blood.
You think about donating blood one day...
But you worry that a single needle would make you explode.
Hi, friend! Let's hang out and eat ice cream?
Aww... come hang out later, okay?
So, do you play golf?
Why do you ask that?
Well, you're carrying a golf club around.
Oh, this is supposed to be my magic staff.
That's a magic staff?
Apparently, any stick can work so I'm using what I have.

If you had a chance, wouldn't you rather get a spear
or something?
No way! That's too scary!
But wouldn't it be strong with the pointy tip?
...I want to hug something when I'm scared...
...I guess pointy tips are scary too.
What are you scared of then?
Drowning.
But aren't you a crab!?
I can swim, okay!

Just the thought of this boat breaking and me falling off
scares me, alright?
Had any of your other inventions broke?
All of them.
Scary!
Hey, Hazuki. Do you want some chocolate too?
No, I'm okay.
What do you like then?
Tacos!
Hmm? What got you into tacos?
Sometimes, I like imagining myself as the meat in the taco.

Just lying down.
And when I get picked up, I get hugged by the sides.
And that makes me comfortable.
Okay, that's a little weird.
Sorry. I kinda like the thought of being protected.
I-I'm scared of the world.
Wouldn't you prefer being wrapped in a burrito instead?
Umm...
...I just like the taste of tacos more.
Hazuki, how did you get through school?
I'm used to suffering, so I'm able to survive.
How did you survive math then?
What?
But you're an inventor!
Aren't you supposed to be smart?

Just because I love inventing
doesn't mean I have to like math!
I have to use math, but it stinks!

It's like how people love food,
but cooking spooks them so we have airfryers.

Are you at least having fun
doing the math for your inventions?
Of course! Inventing is fun!
I guess don't worry too much about the math in school.
You're learning a lot more applying math on stuff you like.

Is that why you're bonking people in the head
with your golf club?

It's so that you can injure people and study being a doctor
on your own time, right?
No! They're the ones attacking me!
I'm just trying to live!

Yo, Hazuki!
Got anything I can hold for ya?

en: I have stuff to drop off
I need my stuff with me right now

text.en: Don't be a hoarder, alright?

1. Season the chicken,
then dredge in flour.

2. Coat each breast in egg,
then press into the Panko.

3. Fry the chicken katsu
until golden brown.
4. Put on plate
5. Slice up the pieces
6. Put on that sauce
7. Get dat rice
8. Do a cool pose as you serve
